abstract: Zhang Chunjiang, the former vice chairman of China Mobile, was sentenced to death with a two-year reprieve, giving him the possibility of life in prison for good behavior.
snippet: Zhang Chunjiang, the former vice chairman of China Mobile, was sentenced to death with a two-year reprieve, giving him the possibility of life in prison for good behavior.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — A former executive at China Mobile, one of this country’s biggest state-owned telecommunications companies, was sentenced to death with a two-year reprieve Friday for accepting bribes, according to Xinhua, the state-run news agency.

headline.main: Former China Mobile Official Sentenced in Bribery Case
headline.print_headline: Former China Mobile Official Sentenced in Bribery Case
